comment: The worst professor I've ever had the displeasure of working with. Vague instructions on everything. Big projects assigned at the last minute. We got so behind we never even read one of the books she made us purchase. It was a small class, all Jr's/Sr's in the program, and we were all confused, lost, and stressed all semester. You've been warned.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: I only got an A because I was good at French prior to the class. She assigns big presentations like on Sunday and then it's due on Tuesday, and she never gives full credit for anything besides the quizzes because you have be active with the French club to get the final 5 points, so joining the French club and going outside of class is required.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lots of homework

comment: I think she is a great teacher.
rating_tags: Participation matters--EXTRA CREDIT--Gives good feedback

comment: Worst French course ever. She is consistently late both with class and feedback. She gives vague instructions and then will blame you for being wrong. She's the most inconsistent grader. Will not post any homework, including large projects, until 2 days before. She'll grow your language ability but the stress is not worth it.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Lots of homework

comment: One of the hardest French courses i've ever taken. She's consistently late to class, and she doesn't post material until the night before the class. Can sometimes be unorganized and blames the class when we don't know what she wants us to do. Very useful for wanting to grow in French though.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Gives good feedback

comment: I changed my mind since the last review. No amount of unsolicited work is worth taking a class for. Doing project-size assignments in less than a week's notice and having them overlap due to unclear due dates is completely absurd. This is a conversation class and my speaking has barely improved. Please get a teacher who has clearer expectations.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: I feel that Brinson does an exceptionally better job teaching a conversation class than her other courses. You mostly spend your time analyzing Francophone music and discussing related themes. There's a lot of work due before each class, but not bad IF you have a light schedule. There are still organizational faults mentioned in previous reviews.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--So many papers

comment: Despite what some have said, she is really a great professor. Of course if just getting an "A" is your objective and you really don't want to learn to speak french, take one of the other professors who teach French in English!
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Group projects--Respected

comment: This course was so disorganized. Does not answer to emails. I felt like the lady from the YouTube videos that she assigned us to watch taught me more than professor actually did. Do not take her online, you will not learn anything you are not able to teach yourself.

I can tell Brinson is eager to help her students, but she's intimidating. She tends to drop work without much warning, though most of the assignments and quizzes are questions you've already practiced in class. She has her nice moments but for the most part you have to swallow your pride taking this course. Don't get too creative with your writing.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Lots of homework

comment: Awesome instructor. She actually takes the time to read your work and gives specific feedback which is not the case with the other instructors in that department who gives you a grade without feedback. I learn a lot with her. She is available to meet with you and she will help you. You MUST attend class to pass and read the material to pass.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Caring

comment: DO NOT TAKE AT ALL COSTS! start off with the good. She improves your french a little. In doing so, you will go through the most grueling and painful 10 weeks of your life. Oh and she has no respect for her students and demonstrates it considerably by being blatantly rude towards them and if you're not confident in speaking, DEFINITELY do not take
rating_tags: So many papers--Tough grader

comment: If I could give one suggestion for my ENTIRE tenure as a student at KSU, it would be to NEVER take this professor if possible. She makes you work very hard and will help your proficiency in certain aspects, with that being said, I must warn that she talks down to her students often and gives more assignments than upper level biology classes I took
rating_tags: Lots of homework--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: Probably one of the toughest professors Ive ever taken. If youre not confident in your french, I would HIGHLY recommend not taking her because she has a way of speaking which only makes you much less confident (fortunately for me I am half french and fluent, and she still gave me dirty looks). At least theres extra credit :/
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: 350 characters aren't enough to express my endless frustration with this PROFESSOR who teaches this class. On top of the stupid amount of Homework the professor is HORRIBLE. How do you like finding out your exam grade 1 month l8tr, or ridiculously unintelligible instructions? Not sure what her problem is but it's not worth it to take her.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Sets unrealistic deadlines and then blames the students when things aren't done on time. Extremely negative and discouraging when giving feedback. Will make you forget why you like French in the first place.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read

comment: I don't know where to start. She is extremely disorganized and assigns way more homework than is possible in a weekend. What's more, you'll have no idea what the hw will be until she emails you Friday night. I lost so much sleep doing it. The syllabus is irrelevant after the first week. She is late to every class and was 40 mins late to the final!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Dr. Viakinnou-Brinson is so intelligent and kind. Her class is mostly verbal communication and her tests focus more on writing in French. Watch for spelling, as she does not hesitate to take off points for misspelled words or missing accent marks. She is so approachable and caring during office hours. Do your work, READ SYLLABUS, and apply yourself
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--Respected

comment: She gives a lot of extra credit so you can pull through. Sometimes she's everywhere but the class is based on the book, study the study guides, get ready to write, and participate!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: The amount of work she gives easily exceeds the 3 credit hours you will be accredited (IF YOU PASS). Her entire system is suffocating & disorganized. She's EXTREMELY PETTY, her grading system is cruel, overall communication is unclear, & blames her students when she messes up. She is arrogant, unprofessional, bad at her job, and will make you cry.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--SO MANY PAPERS--Tests are tough

comment: This courseload contained more hours of work in the semester than all of my other classes combined.  The professor is comically disorganized and flaky.  She changes assignment parameters and due dates whimsically. The worst part is that despite this course being about speaking French, that was not her focus at all.  She's arrogant and awful.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: I would like to start off by saying that the workload is a little ridiculous. I understand this is college but come on. All she cares about is the Children African book project she makes you do and then she forces you to pay for it to be laminated and bound. I am struggling in this class and I am French. If you are a commuter, do not take her.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: She is a very nice person but does give a lot of work, sometimes feel a little bit like high school BUT you will learn unlike the French guy that just give you a grade and just correct your grammar.  If you want to improve your French, SHE IS IT.  I would take her again and again and again ... always available, respond to e-mails within a week.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--Respected

comment: Dr. VB is the greatest teacher in the program.  Better than the others for sure.  Native speaker, passionate about Africa, she will show you text that neither Griffin or the other guy I can't remember his name because he is NOT French and he is NOT proficient in French for sure and should be teaching Italian instead of French.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: This is the hardest class I've ever taken, and I now hate French because of it.  The workload is too much to handle unless you only take this class.  She is unclear, but don't go to the syllabus looking for answers because you'll only end up more confused than before.  If not a required class for your major, avoid at all costs.

Even though she's hard to avoid, Dr. Brinson is not worth taking. Your performance in other classes will suffer because of all of the work she gives. You will have projects as well as busy-work every week and her feedback is confusing and rude. She constantly criticizes and make you feel like all of your practice is useless. Warning: you may cry.

Professor is caring and has unreasonably high expectations for the amount of time we have to learn the material.  The tests were hard,  the homework website was very picky and takes MULTIPLE hours to finish.   Take another French class or don't take French at all if you're looking for a moderately easy 1st level French class.

Dr. Viakinnou is a sweetheart. She will push you and give you a lot to do, but she is always willing to change due dates according to how the class is feeling. She will do everything in her power to see that you get the best grade you can, especially if she sees that you're trying. My favorite French prof at KSU.

Prof is unclear and unorganized. Changes rules AFTER giving assignments; gives "stealth" assignments that you must search for on D2L; has obscure test questions on material not covered in class; doesn't coordinate project due dates  with exams; unrealistic expectations of time needed to complete assignments. Frustrating and disappointing class.

Unorganized!AVOID at all costs! If she doesn't like u, she will definitely show it through rude comments & awful facial expressions. She wants u to be exactly like her. If u don't say/write what she thinks is best, then ur grade will reflect.Creativity/opinions constricted bc she is a CONTROL FREAK. Unrealistic work load. Bully,intimidator, etc.

Great professor. Not a pushover. If you think attending class earns you an "A", this is not the class for you. Lots of extra credit and extra time spent with studentS. If you are in school to learn, take her class. If you want an easy class ......e

She was awesome, loved her class. She conveys the information in many different ways like power point and speaking to us in French.  As long as you take the time to study the vocab, do the supersite homework and pay attention you will get a good grade. Take her you want regret it and she is a very nice person

As others have said, VERY unorganized. And for a freshman level gen ed course, there was TOO much expected of the students.  Too many nit-picky assignments. She made us participate in a talent show. I definitely considered taking a WF at some points. AVOID.

Very unorganized. Never clear when assignments are due and then when you ask her about it she gets flustered and asks you to leave her alone.  If you show up you will easily do well on participation grades and tests but she has so many other pointless assignments that I'm not even sure how much the participation and tests count.
confusing; lack of teacherly skills - you're on your own.
Hard teacher, but well worth it. My writing improved tremendously. She is very helpful. Yes you do write a lot, but it is a writing class! if you love french, she is the teacher to have.

Let it not be said that Dr. Viakinnou-Brinson is easy. She's as tough as they come, but you will benefit in the end. Her teaching method forces you to learn by being very critical of your errors. I recommend her, but only if you truly love French. It will seem annoying and laborious otherwise.

I took this prof for French 1001 and was extremely disappointed. She is very disorganized and never explains things to the class. She teaches the class completely in French, which helps on vocab, but hurts on grammar and structure. I only learned what I already knew from prior french knowledge. I would NOT recommend this professor.

She is a beautiful lady with a beautiful accent and a very sweet personality!! I learned alot and class was always fun... however... she is extremely unorganized and not clear with assignments/due dates. She never turned anything back to you quickly. Rarely responded to e-mails. It became very frustrating. Tests are easyy

She is an amazing professor. My French writing improved a lot in her class. I had her for French 3305 too and I went from getting D's on papers to getting A's. She corrects all of your papers and lets you rewrite them. Her french is beautiful and your accent will greatly improve. She is EXTREMELY helpful especially if you see her outside of class.

Very sweet person but not a good teacher.  Totally disorganized moving academic stuff for the talent show which I really don't see why in the world we do this ... this is college, not high school.  I also find her to grade tough and you better show up for every class, she keeps track of your absence

She doesn't really help when the class is confused. As the semester progressed she seemed scattered, due dates were flexible and we spent way too long on the opening class question (like what did you do this weekend), so long in fact that sometimes we didn't spend any time on grammar points. She would jump into the examples before any explanations.

She just didn't really know what she was doing. Would become rather rude to students. would move on to a different subject regardless of whether or not the class understood the last topic or not. Very unorganized. I wouldn't recommend at all and certainly regret taking.
Very nice, helpful professor.
I love her class. She is very helpful. She goes the extra mile for the students. A lot of work but you will learn a lot

Loved her!Teaches in target language which seems intense but after a couple of weeks it makes you learn vocab and how to structure your sentences.A lot of extra credit available making it easy to get a good grade.She is extremely helpful with writing assignments especially if you see her during office hours.Great class,would love to have her again!

She was ok.  She seemed to have a grudge against some students.  Slows down pace of class for everyone's understanding and then makes up for lost lectures by testing and assignments every lecture the last 2 weeks of class. Doesn't grade the same for everyone.
